intro: Terminalia leandriana var. ankarensis, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and timber use, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
